Finally, add line 4 from (0, 0.25) to (0, 0) to close the loop. Next, scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system, which has an euler angle of (0, 0, -90) and a translation vector of (0, 0.375, 0). Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.125 units in the direction of the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.75. Part 2 Create a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with euler angles of (0, 0, -90) and a translation vector of (0, 0.25, 0). Now, we will create the 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. Create loop 1 and add line 1 from (0, 0) to (0.125, 0). Add line 2 from (0.125, 0) to (0.125, 0.25). Add line 3 from (0.125, 0.25) to (0, 0.25). Finally, add line 4 from (0, 0.25) to (0, 0) to close the loop. Next, scale the sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.25. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the specified coordinate system, which has an euler angle of (0, 0, -90) and a translation vector of (0, 0.25, 0). Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with an extrusion depth of 0.25 units in the direction of the normal, and no extrusion in the opposite direction. The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.25. Part 3 Create a three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a tapering top, resembling a pyramid. The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.125.</description>
